meanings.definition: The act of moving backward or receding.
meanings.sent1: The retrocessions of the ocean waves created a calming rhythm on the shore.
meanings.sent2: The retrocessions of the glacier revealed ancient rock formations.
meanings.sent3: The retrocessions of the car in the parking lot made it look like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: The retrocessions of time seemed to pull everything into the past.
meanings.sent5: The retrocessions of the river's flow painted a picture of nature's cycle.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring or giving back something, especially money or property.
meanings.sent1: The retrocessions of the borrowed book were greatly appreciated by the owner.
meanings.sent2: The retrocessions of the stolen goods were a relief to the victim.
meanings.sent3: The retrocessions of the lost wallet by a stranger restored faith in humanity.
meanings.sent4: The retrocessions of the charity funds ensured transparency and trust.
meanings.sent5: The retrocessions of the misplaced keys saved the day for the forgetful traveler.

meanings.definition: The act of reverting to a previous state or condition.
meanings.sent1: The retrocessions of the old building to its original design pleased the historical society.
meanings.sent2: The retrocessions of the garden to its former glory required hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent3: The retrocessions of the computer system to an earlier version caused chaos in the office.
meanings.sent4: The retrocessions of the weather to winter conditions caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent5: The retrocessions of the patient's health to a better state brought hope to the family.
